name: check_robots_txt
description: Check robots.txt file to determine if web crawling is allowed and get crawl delay recommendations

url.description: URL to check (can be base domain like 'https://example.com' or specific path like 'https://example.com/admin')

user_agent.description: User agent string to check rules for (optional, defaults to tool's default user agent)

robots_url.description: The robots.txt URL that was consulted

can_fetch.description: Whether crawling is allowed for this URL and user agent

crawl_delay.description: Suggested crawl delay in seconds (null if not specified in robots.txt)

note.description: Additional notes (e.g., if robots.txt not found)

error.description: Error message if robots.txt couldn't be read

metadata.author: Ashutosh Sinha
metadata.note: Always check robots.txt before crawling to respect website policies. If robots.txt doesn't exist, crawling is generally allowed. Crawl-delay directive indicates minimum seconds between requests.

examples.description: Check if homepage can be crawled
Check specific path with custom user agent
